original: Ålander, Anton Knut Gotthard, arkitekt, Göteborg, f. 5/5/92 i Blidsberg, Älvsb. 1., av kontr :prost. W. Å. o. Anna Littorin. G. 23 m. Greta Bogren. Barn: Lars f. 25, Sven 29, Ann 43. — CTI 15, KTH 16. Stud:res. t. Tyskl., Engl. o. Frankr. 12-26. Anst. h. arkit. Karl M. Bengtson i Gbg 16-20, egen arkit:verks, i Gbg sed. 20. Fd. led. av kyrkofullm, i Örgryte förs. Suppl. i Gbgs byggn:nd, stadsarkit. i Mariestad. Utf. ritn. t. sjukh., tingshus, stadshus, banker, ålderdomshem o. yrkessk. i Gbg m. fl. städer. Erh. ett flert. första pris i arkit :tävl. RVO.
translated: Ålander, Anton Knut Gotthard, architect, Gothenburg, b. 5/5/92 in Blidsberg, Älvsborg County, son of the vicar W. Å. and Anna Littorin. Married on 23/xx to Greta Bogren. Children: Lars b. 25, Sven b. 29, Ann b. 43. Graduated from CTI in 1915, KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1916. Studied abroad in Germany, England, and France from 1912-1926. Employed by architect Karl M. Bengtson in Gothenburg from 1916-1920, established own architectural firm in Gothenburg since 1920. Former member of the church council in Örgryte parish. Substitute member in Gothenburg's building committee, city architect in Mariestad. Completed designs for hospitals, courthouses, city halls, banks, nursing homes, and vocational schools in Gothenburg and other cities. Received several first prizes in architectural competitions. Awarded with the Royal Victorian Order (RVO).
